channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Gen Z question the values of higher ed, CEO at this nearly $1 billion company says it’s ‘silly’ to think one degree will be enough education for life
item.description: Udemy CEO Hugo Sarrazin says the degrees vs. skills debate should be focused on “cohabitation.”

item.title: Great Leaders Don’t Pick Just One Lane
item.description: The four types of conflicts you need to master to lead through constant change.

item.title: Tom Holland’s N.A. Beer Brand Is Nearing 8-Figures in Annual Revenue Thanks to an Unexpected Strategy
item.description: In an increasingly crowded field, co-founder and CEO John Herman shares how Bero is standing out.

item.title: A record-breaking government shutdown is almost over, leaving no winners but plenty of frustration
item.description: The longest government shutdown in history could conclude as soon as Wednesday, Day 43, with almost no one happy with the final result. Democrats didn...

item.title: Circle Internet Group stock is sliding despite strong revenue and higher average USDC in circulation
item.description: Circle Internet Group released its third-quarter earnings on Wednesday, November 12, announcing a 66% jump in revenue and reserve income year-over-yea...

item.title: Heavy solar storms could trigger northern lights and more, according to NOAA
item.description: Space weather forecasters issued an alert on Tuesday for incoming severe solar storms that could produce colorful northern lights and temporarily disr...

item.title: Kim Kardashian’s Skims is now worth $5 billion after a massive $225 million funding round led by Goldman Sachs
item.description: Young people are obsessed with Kim K's shapewear line. Nearly 70% of Skims' customers are Gen Z or millennials.

item.title: How delayed SNAP benefits are hurting small U.S. grocers and convenience stores
item.description: A little more than a year ago, Ryan Sprankle welcomed President Donald Trump to one of the three grocery stores his family owns near Pittsburgh. Trump...

item.title: Trump’s plan to give Americans a $2,000 tariff dividend ‘misses the mark’, experts say. Here’s why
item.description: President Donald Trump boasts that his tariffs protect American industries , lure factories to the United States, raise money for the federal governme...

item.title: How Cisco is leaning on recruiting and upskilling staff in the AI era—instead of mass layoffs
item.description: As AI reshapes the workplace, Cisco is betting on its existing workforce instead of mass layoffs—arming them to code, innovate, and adapt.

item.title: Kim Kardashian’s Skims Just Hit a Huge Valuation Milestone Thanks to Goldman Sachs
item.description: The shapewear brand plans to expand into new stores and products.

item.title: Gen Z isn’t doom spending. Wasting money on flashy purchases is normal while you’re young and have nothing else to be admired for yet, expert says
item.description: “My aspiration for material stuff is the inverse of what else I have to offer the world,” The Psychology of Money author said.

item.title: Top Recruits Keep Abandoning Job Applications. Here’s How to Fix That
item.description: Complicated questions and time-consuming requirements prompt many highly qualified applicants to simply quit before they finish contacting prospective...

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says the secret to climbing the corporate ladder flows through this department—and Tim Cook is proof it works
item.description: The secret to CEO success isn’t knowing how to code or use AI chatbots—it’s mastering the supply chain, according to Ford’s Jim Farley.

item.title: In the Age of AI, the Human Touch Is an Advantage
item.description: Here’s how to help your business stand out with differentiators that machines can’t replicate.
